item.title: Today’s Contexto #1256: Hints & Answer For February 25, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Contexto is a word association game that gives you a new word to guess every single day. With every attempt, the AI algorithm determines how close your guess is to the daily answer based on thematic and contextual similarity.

Sometimes, though, no matter how experienced you are, the word you’re looking for can be incredibly vague and hard to deduce. Luckily for you, this guide is full of hints to give you a helping hand, but make sure you give today’s Contexto a go if you haven’t already!

How To Play Contexto

Contexto is incredibly simple to play, but difficult to master. All you have to do is type words into the search bar, and the AI algorithm will tell you how close your word is to the answer.

You’ll know how close your guess is based on the colour of the bar and the number next to it.

  • Red includes guesses with the number 1,501 and above, meaning you’re way off from the secret word.
  • Orange includes guesses between 301 and 1,500, meaning you’re getting closer, but still some ways off.
  • Green includes guesses between 1 and 300, meaning you’re on the right track.

Best Contexto Tips & Tricks

  • Start off using broad terms, then narrow down once you’ve got under the 1,000 mark.
  • Try using Nouns first, and dip into verbs or adjectives once you’ve discovered the context.
  • Experiment with random words at times, especially as different forms of a root word can rank differently, such as work and worker.
  • Guess away, as unlike other word games like Wordle, you aren’t limited to a strict number of attempts.

Best Starting Words For Contexto

Here are some great starting words to get you going with Contexto:

  • Thing
  • Person
  • Place
  • Animal
  • Work
  • Nature
  • Game
  • Concept
  • Idea
  • Food

Contexto Hints For Today, February 25, 2026

Without giving away today’s Contexto answer, here are a few helpful hints to get you thinking in the right direction:

  • Hint 1: Type of food
  • Hint 2: Healthy snack
  • Hint 3: Type of melon

If they don’t help, then here are the nine closest words, going from tenth to second:

  • Cucumber
  • Sorbet
  • Guava
  • Pineapple
  • Papaya
  • Nectarine
  • Watermelon
  • Cantaloupe
  • Melon

Today’s Contexto Answer For Game #1256 On February 25, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, and still can’t figure out today’s Contexto answer, then you can find it down below:

Answer: Honeydew

A Honeydew is a variety of melon with smooth, pale skin and sweet, green flesh.

When Is The Next Contexto Game After #1256?

Contexto is updated daily at 12 AM or Midnight in your respective time zone, meaning the next game will start on February 26

The Contexto schedule is very consistent, with a new game releasing at the same time every day.

How did you find today’s Contexto? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For more daily guides, check out IG’s other word game guides:

  • NYT Strands
  • Wordle

item.title: Today’s Strands #724 Hints and Answers for February 25, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Strands is a daily word search puzzle game from The New York Times. It is a relatively new game, launched in 2024, in which players seek a common theme among words in a 6×8 letter grid.

Whether it’s your first time playing or you’re a Strands veteran, today’s tips and strategies can help you find words faster. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Strands, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answers for Strands Game #724 for Wednesday, February 25, 2026

To play today’s Strands, head to the game’s website.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s edition of Strands. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Strands

Strands is a daily word search that challenges you to find words with a common theme. There’s also a Spanagram that reveals the deeper theme behind the words.

  • Words that are three letters and under do not count.
  • Words that reveal the correct theme appear in blue.
  • The Spanagram turns yellow when found.
  • Finding three words that don’t fit the theme will reveal a hint to help you find the proper words.

The goal is to string together as many words as possible. Every letter on the grid gets used! Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Strands can only be played on the New York Times website. You can also play on the NYT Games app.

Strands Hints For Today, February 25, 2026

The Strands’ answers for Game #722 are all related to a very specific musical instrument. Think Johnny Cash, Elvis Presley, and Jimi Hendrix. If you’re a wrestling fan, think Jeff Jarrett, the Honky Tonk Man, and Elias. Bear in mind that the answers are all generic things in relation to the instrument.

General Strands Hints For February 25

Without giving today’s Strands answers completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: Red __, come on over.
  • Hint 2: DirecTV used to install these on your roof.
  • Hint 3: Aliens will sometimes do this to humans they abduct in sci-fi stories.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Strands #724 for February 25, 2026.

Words to Help You Find Strand Hints for February 25, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Strands answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you unlock some in-game hints. A few starter words that may help are:

  • RATE
  • TELL
  • ROVE
  • SATIRE
  • RATE

Today’s Strands Answer For Game #724 On February 25, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answers to today’s Strands below. Check out the answers for yesterday’s puzzle here.

  • PROBE
  • ORBITER
  • MODULE
  • LANDER
  • ROVER
  • SATELLITE
  • SPANAGRAM: SPACECRAFT

If you solved today’s Strands without our answers, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

When Is The Next Strands Game After #724?

All New York Times games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before, giving players a heads-up. The game on February 26 will be Strands Game #725.

What Is Strands?

Strands is a daily word search puzzle game created by The New York Times. Launched in 2024, Strands challenges players to discover a common theme among words in a 6×8 letter grid. The game’s original concept was developed by Juliette Seive, a research director on The New York Times Games team, with the aim of replicating Wordle’s success. Tracy Bennett serves as the puzzle editor for Strands, overseeing the creation and curation of daily puzzles since its launch.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Gray Zone Warfare is Now a ‘PvE-First’ Tactical Shooter
item.content:encoded:
MADFINGER Games continues to evolve Gray Zone Warfare in a strong and sensible direction. The open-world tactical shooter has undergone more than a few changes in recent history, and it’s becoming increasingly impressive with each new drop.

Recently, the team made an update to the game’s identity on Steam, including a term in the product description that’s not seen too often in the tactical shooter space. Gray Zone Warfare, the sumptuous sandbox shooter, is now ‘PvE-first’.

What Does PvE-First Mean for Gray Zone Warfare?

Once upon a time, Gray Zone Warfare was described as an extraction shooter, with a twist. Players could run into and out of the game world, unbound by any kind of timer-based limitations, and explore the diverse, lush setting of Lamang at will. It bore classic trademarks of the extraction genre, but it was so much more than that.

That concept was recognized by MADFINGER with a pivot last year, with the team officially dubbing Gray Zone Warfare a tactical MMOFPS. It was explained:

You’re not heading back to base nearly as often. Tasks can be turned in from the field. Your time is spent moving from COP to COP, POI to POI. The world encourages staying out longer, discovering more, encountering more PvP—and staying immersed.

You’re not jumping in and out of isolated raids. You’re living in this world. It’s a tactical MMOFPS. It’s persistent. It’s dangerous. It’s accessible—whether you’re new or a seasoned vet.

It might look like an extraction shooter on the surface, but it’s something different. Something of its own. That’s what makes it special.

However, things have changed again, and Gray Zone Warfare has a whole new identity:

High-Stakes PvE-First Open-World Tactical Shooter

It’s a brilliant way to label everything the game offers in one sweep. It has the high-stakes mentality of an extraction shooter, the PvE-first focus that the developers are keen to flesh out, the open-world sandbox elements, and, above all else, it’s a tactical first-person shooter.

It’s borderline milsim, mixed in with survival mechanics.

The PvE-first element, as we’ve learned, is a concept that the studio’s CEO and Co-Founder, Marek Rabas, is keen to remain heavy on. There are some ‘amazing moments and stories’ to pull from the PvP world, and that’s not going anywhere in Gray Zone (and will be expanded on in due course), but the PvE push is now front and centre in this game.

In recent months, we’ve seen many more shooters lean more into the concept of PvE.

For instance, Escape from Tarkov is a couple of years deep into running a mirrored PvE platform that accommodates thousands of users. Elsewhere, ARC Raiders players never stop debating the potential for a PvE mode to surface in that extraction adventure title.

Gray Zone Warfare perfectly suits a PvE operating model, and it does little to take away from the game’s inherent challenge and risk profile. There’s every opportunity for you to run into an opposing faction and get into a firefight, but much of that tension is now centered entirely around AI enemies.

It’s very worth pointing out that, since the beginning, Gray Zone’s ‘Joint Operations’ mode has facilitated 100% PvE combat…

Do you think it’s a win for Gray Zone’s developers to be focusing on PvE? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that The Elder Scrolls Online is getting a direct showcase

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

More from Grant Taylor-Hill
